data.title: Show team number when hovering over units?
data.body:
I cant remember my teammates names, so it would be useful that when i point to unit, it would either show team number or simply "enemy" or "ally".

In FFA games it would be more useful to know the team number as well?

<bountysource-plugin>

---

data.title: Merging the tabs graphic into the team chrome graphic.
data.body:
There is a lot of negative space in the allied/soviet chrome image files, and the tabs being in a separate file where all teams are together seems less modular.

Limitation coming from only being able to have one set of Tabs nodes available to represent all teams instead of for each team.

data.title: Fixed a crash when there are no actors to reveal shroud on the map.
data.body: as described in https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6166. This does not fix https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/6097 although I tried several alternatives.

data.title: Including credits local to the mod.
data.body:
This first derived from a question about customizing the main menu and button interfaces/pages.

Make a way to support viewing credits local to a mod; separately viewable from the engine's credits.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3648160-including-credits-local-to-the-mod?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: RenderInfantry refactoring
data.body:
Removes `RenderInfantryProne` and `RenderInfantryPanic` traits, and moves that "react when attacked" behavior into `RenderInfantry` itself. An interface called `IRenderInfantrySequenceModifer` was added and both `TakeCover` and `ScaredyCat` traits implement it. Those classes were also cleaned up as well.

I think there's 5 upgrade scenarios in total and rules were created. Needed to be careful not to mess with Spy though.

```
Rules:
    ProneActor:
        -RenderInfantry:
        RenderInfantryProne:
            IdleAnimations: idle1, idle2
    PanicActor:
        -RenderInfantry:
        RenderInfantryPanic:
            IdleAnminations: idle1, idle2
    NewProneActor:
        RenderInfantryProne:
            IdleAnminations: idle1, idle2
    NewPanicActor:
        RenderInfantryPanic:
            IdleAnminations: idle1, idle2
    LeaveThisSpyAlone:
        -RenderInfantry:
        RenderDisguise:
            IdleAnimations: idle1, idle2
```

becomes

```
    ProneActor:
        RenderInfantry:
            IdleAnimations: idle1, idle2
    PanicActor:
        RenderInfantry:
            IdleAnminations: idle1, idle2
    NewProneActor:
        RenderInfantry:
            IdleAnminations: idle1, idle2
    NewPanicActor:
        RenderInfantry:
            IdleAnminations: idle1, idle2
    LeaveThisSpyAlone:
        -RenderInfantry:
        RenderDisguise:
            IdleAnimations: idle1, idle2
```

data.title: Selling conyard at start gives you kills
data.body:
When I sell my starting conyard, I get kills added to my statistics, presumably the infantry that emerges from the conyard.

When other buildings are used, the killcount is the same as the number of infantry you had, they get added to your own kills. Intentional?

data.title: Medic tries to heal structures
data.body: He doesn't have any success, of course, so the actor loops over his healing animation (+ sound) constantly.

data.title: Added Experience, ranks
data.body:
Added Player Trait PlayerExperience, added Actor trait GivesPlayerExperience.
No GUI yet, but the first basics are there. First step for #6154.

data.title: Make background of FMVPlayers in TD and RA black
data.body: Fixes #6211.

data.title: Fixed the automatic wiki documentation update
data.body:
After lessons learned from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRAWeb/pull/135 I resolved by https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5900 by git cloning into `$HOME` to avoid the git inside an existing git repository problem. When testing locally I suggest to remove the lines

```
git config --global user.email "travis@travis-ci.org"
git config --global user.name "travis-ci"
```

data.title: Change attribute modifiers to use integers.
data.body: Adds the bits needed for #6079 and #6202.  I have left de-floating the rest of the speed and firepower plumbing as TODOs, as their required changes rapidly balloon out into a much larger patch.

data.title: Fixed lobby start unit notifications not showing class names
data.body:
as described in #6209. Had to tidy up a lot around it.
- Documented MPStartUnits
- Removed the hard-coded "none", "light", "heavy" classes.
- Moved LobbySettingsNotification into it's own ServerTrait.

data.title: Support power refactor
data.body:
This is a refactor of the support powers to remove the two extra support power classes (SupportPowerManager and SupportPowerInstance).

This conflicts heavily with #6130.

data.title: Disabled bots on maps with separate land masses between destructible bridges
data.body: This is a workaround for the problem described at https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/5754 which is also seen in the wild, because newbies tend to like to keep the AI out, build up their base and then wonder for huge path finder lag spikes in the very late game. Essentially the same problem as island maps. https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/issues/2007

data.title: GlobalUpgradable attempting to get trait from destroyed actor
data.body:
If you make two actors of the same type that have this trait, destroy one of them and then upgrade it crashes with the error of attempting to get a trait from a destroyed actor.

This is because even though GlobalUpgradable defines a method RemovedFromWorld it doesnt implement INotifyRemovedFromWorld.

data.title: Update crushing values for ra vehicles
data.body: This is mostly about consistency with other vehicles/tanks in our ra mod and RA1. It also improves balance in the case of the 1tnk change.

data.title: Fix legacy map importer.
data.body: Fixes #6143.

data.title: TD FMV player background polish
data.body: The background widget uses the standard dialog background, which is translucent and has a red border.  This should be replaced by a solid black background which can replace unused panel-scanline in the chrome artwork.

data.title: Cannot leave replay after failing SP mission.
data.body: The last frame of the loss movie remains covering the screen, blocking the menu and exit buttons.

data.title: Lobby options change notification shows incorrect starting unit descriptions.
data.body: It shows the ID (none, light, heavy) instead of the proper names (MCV Only, Light Support, Heavy Support).

data.title: Fixed UnloadCargo stacking using new subcell API exposure
data.body: Partially supersedes #6083, Cargo.SpawnPassengers will have to wait for my Exit refactoring and discussion on how unloading while being sold should be handled.

data.title: AI: walls are priority target
data.body: AI bombs walls even if they are not significant. It is a great bait for air strikes and nukes.

data.title: Sometimes when starting game, it kicks me out
data.body:
Happens on localhost and on hertzners.

Not sure if this is because of setting debug mode on or not, but i cant remember times when i didnt set it when this happened.

So when i click start, it says "you have been kicked" or something.

data.title: Tanks doesn't pass over fences properly: doesn't always destroy fence
data.body:
Noticed this when the tank is moving in diagonal direction; the fence will remain untouched and tank simply moves through them, even if it moves in 90 degree turns; left, up, left.

Mod: RA

data.title: INotifyActorMovement: Regional Triggers and Conditional Shroud Updates
data.body:
### Goal

I'm attempting to revive @obrakmann's clever #5022, since as pchote said:

> Probably not much perf wins yet, but this adds an interface that we can use for celltriggers and per-player autotarget maps (which should give quite a big perf win).

WIP branch can be found here: https://github.com/UberWaffe/OpenRA/compare/INotifyActorMovement
### Background

I did some code-digging for this from scratch on my own and also came to the conclusion that all `Actor.CenterPosition` changes inevitably go through `ActorMap.UpdatePosition` even when actors get added to the world via `AddPosition`.

The only real difference is that I've taken the bulletin board approach. (I.e. `ActorMap.UpdatePosition` pushes data to `MovementAnnouncer`, which informs all `IMovementListener`)

The Announcer differentiates between position changes `PositionMovementAnnouncement` and cell changes `CellMovementAnnouncement`.

Traits implementing `IMovementListener` have to register / unregister as needed to receive announcements.
### Help needed

Initial tests on `RevealsShroud` looks good, though I do not know how to do a proper performance test on this.

Initial tests on `MapRegion` works, but I have not yet successfully tied in LUA to it. If someone could explain the basic concepts behind `ScriptTriggers.cs` to me, I'd appreciate it.

Lastly, comments on the overall approach would also be appreciated.

data.title: Color selector breaks when choosing the most left hue (=red)
data.body: So if i choose red at left from hue map, then next time i click color selector, it doesnt show the color map under hue anymore, until i press random color button.

data.title: Add power sabotage ability to spy
data.body:
This adds a power sabotage ability to the ra and ts spies in an effort to make them more useful.
I haven't managed to find any suitable sounds I can mix, so there isn't much feedback to the player being infiltrated apart from a yellow selection bar and the disabled overlay for power plants.
I don't think PowerOutageModifier is a good class name, but I haven't been able to come up with something better.

data.title: Add more Lua functions
data.body:
Added more Lua functionality:
- Actor property "InfoName" (probably not the best name, might just want "Name" or "Type") to get the actor type (e.g. E1)
- Player property "PlayerName" (same as old Lua) to get the player's name (e.g. hamb)
- A ctor for WRange (this is required to use Map.ActorsInCircle)
- Modify ActorsInCircle to accept a `nil` filter
- Add Guard to the Combat functions (not sure if this is in the right place)
- Map.NamedActor now returns `nil` if the actor is Destroyed

I'm more interested in a review right now rather than a merge, because there ~~might~~ will be more I add (or maybe that's another PR). If we're happy I can provide a test map using these functions for reviewers.

data.title: Atmosphere Effects?
data.body:
Any way for a mod to include atmosphere effects such as day/night, hot/clear/overcast, rain/storm/snowing, etc?

Except for maybe very small "rain" sprites, this wouldn't need more than some way to darken or change the hue on the screen (for example, a hot day would have a slight yellow to look like the sun searing through the map, or night would make the map much darker).

Being able to cycle through them with programmable timers in a widget would be great too, to add even more variety to the game.

Extra idea: rain/snow effect would slightly slow movement of units, and storms would temporarily disable the radar, if desired.

data.title: Visual effects in different situations
data.body:
In the Nintendo 64 version of Tiberian Dawn, whenever a building was destroyed or the superweapons were used, the camera system would shake to give the effect of the earth-shattering damage.

Similarly, depending on the weapons used, include lighting effects instead of just sprites.

And each of these could be toggled in case someone doesn't want it for their gameplay.
